com:
***READ THE GUIDE***

THE GUIDE: http://gunpla.buyfags.moe/

***READ THE GUIDE***

For those new to gunpla/plamo or even just new to this thread; please read the guide. Please read it before asking questions, as there is a chance it has already been answered there.

For those unfamiliar, "plamo" is a shortened form of "plastic model". If it's made of plastic, someone can probably help you here!
If you're new, you're gonna fuck up. Don't worry! If you're experienced, don't make the new people worry!

And remember to report any shitposting and spam to keep the thread clean and civil.

>Why won't anyone answer my question?
Try being specific, especially about your materials and process. Post images whenever possible; even if the kit/part looks bad, you are more likely to get help posting images.

>Why are my pictures sideways?
4chan strips EXIF data from images when they're uploaded to the site from your phone, including the orientation display tag. To fix this, save your images separately, or use an app that will rotate and save the images for you.
One commonly used app that works well on Android:
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.simplemobilephotoresizer

Material Points, MP. You get them from duplicated loot box items.

Standard Pass.

Previous thread: >>21277686

Let's discuss the best TV series of UC Gundam.
>Should I skip ZZ?
No! ZZ is essential viewing. The First Neo Zeon War is as important as any other conflict in UC history. You miss out on essential character development(Haman & Kamille/Fa, Minerva Zabi), fantastic mecha designs, best OP/ED songs in UC, lots of great new characters (Elpeo Ple, Ple Two, Chara Soon, Roux Louka) including Judau who is one of the best protagonists in Gundam.
>But /m/ told me Moon Moon ruins the show
Absolutely not. Moon Moon is important canon wise now with Moon Gundam being a thing.
>I'm still not convinced
Haman, Kamille, Fa, Bright Noa and other favourites are still there. ZZ is still referenced in newer UC titles showing it's importance and longevity.

The problem with 1stRe is that it's a textbook definition of a game that's hard to recommend.
FM1 has a lot of rough qualities to it, and 1stRe doesn't really change any of those and instead opts to redo the visual presentation to fit more the HD age of graphical fidelity. I think the best way to look at it is that the jank of FM1Re helps to emphasize how big of a jump things are from FM1 to FM2, since the prerelease trailer for 2Remake shows off a far livelier presentation that makes you wonder what the fuck was going through everyone's heads during 1Re. The only explanation I can come up with is one that points to how it was like to go from 1 to 2 on PS1.

>>21322699
>I think you are taking Macross: The First's view on things as indicative of the original show, which isn't necessarily true. When Max and Millia show off their child to the Zentradi they send a load of them running too, because Zentradi feared culture of any kind. Minmany's singing was by far the most effective, because it could be broadcast to such a large audience so easily, but it wasn't the only thing by any means.

pretty much this. Also the scene where they almost shit in the floor at the site of a minmay doll.

The whole theme of Macross was that as two enemies learn about each other, the soldiers on the ground don't want to kill each other. It was probably partly based on how the japanese saw Americans going into ww2. America gave japan modern industry with new factories like Harley Davidson plant (the SDF-1). And the Americans were seen as these giant mobsters/cowboys because of films. And Americans saw japanese people as war obsessed little monkeys too. But after the war, lots of Americans and Japanese got married after they learned about each other's culture. Sure, some people still kept hate in their heart. But others learned about the other's culture and fell in love. There were plenty of Americans that loved japanese stuff, and Japanese people that loved American stuff.

You can see something similar with american black people. Some white people loved black food, music and art and it helped them let go of racism against black people. If you want to get deep into it, black culture even helped white people reclaim things lost from their pagan past,. The sexual nature of black dancing and music had been purged by the church in most white communities.

It either happened in DYRL or sometime after, but everything was shifted to a more romantic message of "love and music" saves us all. But originally it was all culture. The spies defected because they wanted to live like humans, not just to listen to music.

>U.C 0079: The Principality of Zeon declares a war of independence against the Earth's Federated government, leading into a conflict historical known as "The spacenoid independence war". >U.C 0087/88: Hostilities between the Earth's Federated government and the anti-government insurgent movement known as "Alliance against Earth" breaks out into a full-scale war, coming to be known as "The second spacenoid independence war". During this period of time, the Federation capitol of Dakar is nearly sacked, only being protected due to the actions of Bright Noa,the Federation would carve out a victory in this brutal period. Shortly following this victory, a period of chaos in the Federations government would take place with the revealing of the "Deeproots", a collective of political and industrial elites vying to use the conflict for their own gains. Leading a purge of this element, B**gh* N** would move to centralize his control over the Federations government and to push for the defeat of the Alliance agianst Earth. Shortly following this centralization of power however, [***** ***] would call for the total assimilation of the anti-Zeon task force, Titans. Utilizing these newly gained resources, the Alliance against Earth would be defeated with the combined efforts of the Federation, and the return of the long missing hero of the Federation, NT-1, or "Amuro Ray". As originally promised, [Bright] would begin rapidly pushing for reforms to the Earth's sphere...

>Five years have passed...

>U.C 0093: Born from the looming shadow of the regime of [Bright], a woman claiming to be the true successor to Zeon, a man desperate to return order to a world in chaos, and the father of the greatest soldier in the Federations history, make their moves...

Well the upsizing trend was a push for performance trend. Since they kept wanting more mobility and firepower which needed bigger reactors which needed a bigger suit. Armor wasn't as big a need but they needed the performance

Remember the downsizing trend was tied towards a major breakthrough in reactor design which meant they could get equivalent output in a much smaller package which was the driving force in the rapid downsizing towards the 15m form factor since if they could get everything they wanted for weapons and performance and it being CHEAP at that small scale then they'd jump at it.

Really the Mk II's platform really shows it's potential for molecularity with Barzam and Refined Barzam as those are pretty much Mk IIs with a vismod kit and the ReBarzam is just needing a Mk II head to be a Mk II

com:
Rank the Cutie Honey adaptations. Here's mine:

S-tier: New Cutie Honey. Great writing, great voice acting, full of interesting villains and guest characters. 10/10 face and tits on Honey here
Good tier: Flash & OG anime. Beautiful visuals on both. OG has all those trippy backgrounds while Flash really ramps up the drama by the end.
Meh tier: Re. Not a fan of retarded Honey and bulldyke Natsuko. All style over substance and apes way too much from the 70s anime, which is typical for Annoshit. Hoping the live-action is better.
Shit tier: Universe. Utter fucking garbage. Cheap ugly animation (esp that CGI dimension where all the fights go on) and Honey is a dumb fucking cunt throughout. Only 12 eps and it alrealy feels like a slog to finish

Also been meaning to check out Tears and The Live. Thought on those?

The whole reason he was on New Capenna is because the substance known as Halo was instrumental in the plane somehow resisting a Phyrexian invasion.

The only new character from Neon Dynasty that seems to be relevant for the this current story arc is Kaito, and somehow the Wandering Emperor made it to Dominaria. last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>21309091

The Janissaries, Mamluks, Ghilman etc. were not chattel slaves themselves, no, but they were all bought and raised from chattel slaves into soldiers of the empire. They were afforded more respect and even wages as soldiers, but they were all taken as slaves in war and sold within a given empire until whichever empire took direct ownership of them and started training them. They had no direct rights, wages etc. within that regime until they were made soldiers of it.

You also have things like conscription or impressment that blur the lines, since it involved forcing citizens to become soldiers regardless of their personal view of the matter.

>>21311784

They were only raised from birth once the practice was well underway; they were originally taken from slaves.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>21318887

There are no official records of the Confederacy using slaves as soldiers. They used them as labourers, but never as soldiers. There are a handful of anecdotal examples of Black people firing guns during battles, but nothing official and there are lots of examples of Confederate soldiers refuting the idea it happened too. It did nearly happen though, because the Confederate congress passed a law allowing it after years of debate resisted by people who hated the idea of allowing slaves to serve as soldiers about a week before the Confederacy was defeated, so it never had time to be instituted, but would have given more time.

***READ THE GUIDE***

THE GUIDE: http://gunpla.buyfags.moe/

***READ THE GUIDE***

For those new to gunpla/plamo or even just new to this thread; please read the guide. Please read it before asking questions, as there is a chance it has already been answered there.

For those unfamiliar, "plamo" is a shortened form of "plastic model". If it's made of plastic, someone can probably help you here!
If you're new, you're gonna fuck up. Don't worry! If you're experienced, don't make the new people worry!

And remember to report any shitposting and spam to keep the thread clean and civil.

>Why won't anyone answer my question?
Try being specific, especially about your materials and process. Post images whenever possible; even if the kit/part looks bad, you are more likely to get help posting images.

>Why are my pictures sideways?
4chan strips EXIF data from images when they're uploaded to the site from your phone, including the orientation display tag. To fix this, save your images separately, or use an app that will rotate and save the images for you.
One commonly used app that works well on Android:
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.simplemobilephotoresizer
